context: 'Suurt' is the partitive singular form of the Estonian adjective 'suur'. It means 'large', 'big', or 'great' when used with uncountable nouns or to express a partial amount. The word is used in contexts where we refer to some extent, degree, or portion of something large or important. In the examples provided: 'Ta ostis suurt auto' (He bought a big car - referring to the size), 'Mul on suurt nägu' (I have a big face - describing physical size), and 'Sellest pole suuremat' (There's nothing bigger than this - expressing significance).
